intro: Brugmansia affinis, commonly known as the angel's trumpets, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, pendulous, funnel-shaped flowers that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshade plants. Its leaves are broad, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Brugmansia affinis is known for its rapid growth and can reach heights of up to 10 meters when cultivated in suitable conditions.
